subject: [ANN] Bumblebee 0.4 is released
msgSnippet: Hi All, Bumblebee 0.4 is just released, and can be found here: http://www.agical.com/bumblebee/bumblebee_doc.html Bumblebee is a free (Apache 2 license) open
messageBody:
Hi All,
Bumblebee 0.4 is just released, and can be found here:
http://www.agical.com/bumblebee/bumblebee_doc.html

Bumblebee is a free (Apache 2 license) open source run'n'report
framework that uses the structure of a JUnit test suite to create a
document structure, and the sections in the document are comments
from the tests.
The comments are executed as Ruby string templates to enable pulling
data from different sources, and a wiki syntax is used to provide basic
formatting.
There is also a built in Ruby DSL to include extracted code snippets
from classes and methods.

The release notes can be found here
http://www.agical.com/bumblebee/bumblebee_doc.html#com.agical.bumblebee.acceptance.helpers.Roadmap.releases

Download (including all dependencies, 4.9MB)
http://www.agical.com/bumblebee/download/bumblebee-0.4-dist.zip

Cheers
Daniel Brolund
